intro: Cordula stonei, commonly known as the stone's cordula, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slight fragrance. Cordula stonei is typically found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
